title: Cook Interview

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at DePaul University
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview with five search committee members. Everyone was kind and courteous, but with so many people on the line, it was difficult to keep track of voices and interpret pauses in conversation. This was before video conferencing became a popular interviewing tool, so perhaps the process has changed.
Interview Questions: What interests you about this position?

title: IT Field Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Quick, simple, friendly, nonintimidating. Questions about how you handle customer service and how to approach a general computer issue and start the diagnosis. The interview overall looks to see how you begin problem solving
Interview Questions: What would you do if you had to tell someone that they needed to get their computer replaced?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Many other candidates write about having fun and easy going interviews. Each person's experience depends on the department and interviewers but my experience was one of the most negative interview experiences I've had in a while unforunately. I was initially contacted by a recruiter after applying and had a quick 15 minute phone screening which was fairly standard. I recieved an email for an interview request from a hiring manager the next day to interview that week. Unfortunately, the title of the position and listed duties were either mislabeled in the job posting or the recruiter did not fully understand the responsibilities for it since I was advanced to an interview when I shouldn't have gotten past the phone screening. I also wasn't informed by the recruiter it was a panel interview and was caught off guard by this. The team that interviewed me also seemed a bit dysfunctional as well and the expedited process made me believe they were seeking a quick replacement for unknown reasons. While I'm grateful for the opportunity I was left feeling a like I had interviewed for a different, much higher level position than what I had originally applied for.
Interview Questions: Do you know how SQL databases are used in the back-end of a website?

title: Art School Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at DePaul University
Interview Descriptions: Multiple rounds of interviewing with a few different people. Talking with HR is the most formal and talking with other faculty was more conversational. Lots of time carved out for you to ask questions about the role
Interview Questions: How do you react to frustrating things

title: Chicago Quarter Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at DePaul University
Interview Descriptions: Short interview, typical questions, fun and easy going interviewer that was personable. During interview, was asked about how I would react or respond to certain situations, and did some group interview questions as well.
Interview Questions: What skills do you think would make you a good Chicago Quarter Mentor

title: Intramural Referee Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at DePaul University
Interview Descriptions: It is a pretty easy process only requiring you to talk to your immediate supervisor. only one interview and if you have prior sports experience they will hire you. they really just want to fill positions
Interview Questions: what kind of prior experience do you have

title: Student Technician Interview

Interview Questions: Previous experience with tools? Knowledge about assembling equipment.

title: Assistant Director, Admissions Interview

I then spoke with that team member throughly via phone, they asked prompt and true to the job description questions, unfortunately at the end of the call we discussed  salary, and it was to low for what I was looking for and we decided to end the call cordially. Really nice interviewer and really easy process!

title: Office Assistant Interview

Tell me about yourself.
Do you know the responsibility about this job?

Tell me about yourself
Why you

title: Graduate Assistant Interview

title: Benefits Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and about two weeks later received a phone call to schedule a phone interview with a recruiter. The recruiter asked questions about my work history and explained DePaul's history. She later informed me that she would reach out to me next week for the next steps. After two weeks of not hearing back, I sent the recruiter an email to inquire if I was still being consider for the position. The recruiter never responded. I waited another two weeks and sent another e-mail, but still did not receive a response from the recruiter. I recently received a generic email stating that I was not selected for the position.  Please have more respect for your candidates, and follow up with them as promised.

Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied through DePaul Careers website. Took about two through three weeks to hear back. Was invited for a phone interview. Was told that I would be reached within two weeks in the event that I was invited for an in-person interview. Two and a half weeks later, I was. In person interview took place at DePaul Center. Interviewed with three people. Director, Associate Director, and interim Job Fair & Events Manager. Very professional and informational interview. Once interview was over, was told that I'd receive an answer within a week from HR in the event that I was chosen for an offer. Two weeks passed by and no answer. Got directly contacted via email by one of the interviewers apologizing for delay, and informing me that due to a miscommunication mishap with HR I'd have to wait a bit longer to get an answer. Was once again contacted by interviewer the following week, informing me that a decision was made and unfortunately, and weirdly enough was never reached by HR informing me of the decision.
Interview Questions: What is your managing style like?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at DePaul University
Interview Descriptions: Very quick interview process. Met with the office manger once and heard back within one week. Overall, it was a very positive experience and everyone was very nice. I would recommend applying as a student worker to all students.
Interview Questions: What has been your biggest challenge this year?

title: Advancement Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: I completed an over the phone interview. The interview was pretty straight forward. They asked if I had experience in outbound calls. They preferred you take early classes since the position was after 5. Then, I was asked to come in for an in person interview. The gentleman was really nice and was very excited for me.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for De Paul?

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process took a little over a month from when I applied to the decision-- 3 interviews total (one phone interview with HR, two in-person interviews with the office). Questions were mostly about past work experiences, why DePaul, and one exercise in which I walked them through the process of planning an event. After the final interview, the decision was made in 2 days.
Interview Questions: What is one aspect of this position that would be a challenge for you?

title: Marketing & Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a 30 minute phone conversation. The interviewer was kind and took the time to answer my questions. They made it clear that in this role you would wear many hats and fill in as needed, including giving tours.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my work history, applicable skills, and how comfortable / familiar I was with graphic design as well as public speaking.

title: Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was relatively easy and straightforward. The people who interviewed me didn't try to intimidate, but seemed genuinely interested in learning more about me personally and professionally. I could tell that my skill level was important but they also wanted to gage if I would fit in to the work culture.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you struggled to work with someone and how did you overcome it?

title: Student Affairs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions:
All day, multiple meetings - department, students, division, partner departments...
It was a long and very thorough process. The employees joked that it was putting candidates through the ringer. It was a thoughtful process and respectful.
Interview Questions: Why DePaul?

title: Part Time Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was professional, but also casual. I was nervous and the interviewer noticed so he helped me get over my nervousness. The questions were about my past work experience and what I would contribute to the school. The interviewer was helpful and his answers were thoughtful. The interview was about 40 minutes long and went over the details of the position. Overall, it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: How do you resolve conflicts in a group?

title: Information Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied on a campus job board and they called me to come in for an interview. I came in and they asked me pretty generic questions and then went into the process of explaining the job to me and making sure I could do the job.
Interview Questions: what can you bring to this work environment?

title: Assistant Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: This was a typical bureaucratic interview process consistent of four interviewers. Each interviewer had a printed out list of questions that they took turns asking the interviewee. Very stereotypical interview questions and be prepared to talk about DePaul's Vincentian values. There was little to no creativity in the questions; it seemed as though this was a standard interview process that DePaul uses for their records across the university.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you used problem solving skills to eradicate an issue on the spot. How does your work ethic correspond to our Vincentian values? Are you more of a big picture person or do you hone in on one thing at a time?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: VERY brief and informal interview. It was 7 minutes. My interviewer failed to read my resume and application properly before calling me in for an interview. He did not realize I could not start until a few months from now... so after he asked about that, he said he was looking for someone right now but I could send in two letters of recommendation just in case there was an opening later on.
Interview Questions: Describe one time you showed leadership

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the head of the department as well as a grad student who was also working in the department. It was the traditional sort of interview process. I was interviewing as a student worker.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength and weakness?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at DePaul University
Interview Descriptions: I applied in the Job board online. then i got called in few weeks for interview then i got the offer after few days. I do not think the interviewers were technical at all. But i was ready for any so i reviewed some questions from my computer science classes.
Interview Questions: What programming languages you use ?

title: Facilities Area Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process is intense. It is a half-day process (approx. 4 hours) where you sit through 3 rounds of interviews with different groups. The first interview involves employees from other departments. The second interview involves the team you will potentially be working with and the final interview is a team of student employees that you would be managing if offered the position.

Overall it was a very positive experience.
Interview Questions: A large portion of this position involves supervision of over 100+ employees. Be prepared to talk about your supervisory experience.

title: Course Online Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online on Student Employment Portal. Received an email regarding my availability and flexibility regarding the shift timings, after responding that I was then called for PI with Manager then followed by Team Interview.
Interview Questions: In PI, mostly from your Resume and Team interview they just want to see how much you are interested in the position.

title: Lab Assistant/Online Technology Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a good process and technical. They checked your technical and problem solving skills. Also, they inquired about your past experience. It was questions regarding the hardware and software issues and how you can solve them. How will you handle the online queries.
Interview Questions: About your past work experience

title: Assistant Professor, Economics Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was an interesting process. It began with questions. It then proceeded with more questions plus a discussion about me and my motivations. The next phase included more questions, followed by a dialogue on the role.
Interview Questions: They asked me to bring a resume

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: The interview took all day, and ate dinner with faculty afterwards. Each member of the faculty met with me. Did not meet all the people in my field. Got a tour of facililties, a nd very bad lunch, and not many breaks.
Interview Questions: No questions about my research. Focused on teaching primarily

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: It was in depth, and comprehensive, but without being intimidating.  I felt that the interview team was sincerely interested in what I could bring to the position, and they asked thoughtful questions.  Each person is different, though, and some members of the interview team seemed less practiced than others, and were just reading from a list of questions.
Interview Questions: How have I handled a disagreement between multiple stakeholders on a project?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and easy! Very genuine. I appreciated their desire to get to know me outside of school, and they were very willing to talk about accommodating my schedule as well as accommodating my other time commitments. There were three people and each had a list of questions to ask and were all interested in actual conversation.
Interview Questions: How do your studies apply to this position?

title: Department Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then in person interview. Everyone in HR I interacted with was very friendly and helpful. My in person interview was conducted by two people. I later found out that they are in a power struggle...so just be aware thay things may not always be what they seem in the interview. They claimed the atmosphere was positive but after nearly 2 years of working there, I have to disagree. Overall, I left the interview feeling really good about my new workplace but left there feeling very differently. This varies from department to department.
Interview Questions: What was a challenging moment in your work experience?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: apply online, interview in person, pass hr test, they make you an offer. I don't have 50 words cause it was really that easy.... 4 people interviewed, last 45mins-1hr. I was told that there were 3 competitive candidates and I won out.
Interview Questions: responding in the face of adversity, try to judge if you have the courage to test authority, can you work on team and individually

title: Staff Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was fairly smooth and straight forward.  Everyone was kind and they were punctual and timely when we met.  This was different from other places where they showed up late. I met with three people, who varied in terms of position, and they each asked different questions, so it  showed there was a coordinated effort to screen candidates.
Interview Questions: There was nothing difficult because I feel I did due diligence when researching the company.

title: Housing Assignments Cooordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was not intimidating. Very friendly individuals and patient with you when you answer. Typical questions such as tell me about yourself, why do you want this job, how can you contribute, why should we choose you.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with any student housing database before?

title: Student Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was held in the conference room, the operations intern conducted the interview and was accompanied by one of the other student receptionists that worked in the office. The questions they asked were pretty typical of what an entry level employer might ask, not really any surprises here. Overall it was pretty relaxed and informal.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you took a leadership position without being asked to.

title: Tele Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: super easy. come in, asked to do a mock call and convince management to donate to depaul university. usually hire on the spot. There were a few questions just generally. If you show up, have passion and seem like you want the jo you will get it. Great first step into sales. Looks great on a resume.
Interview Questions: Can you please try and convince me donate to DePaul.

title: Public Safety Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: My interview was conducted in the Public Safety Office in the basement of the main building, 25 E. Jackson.  I sat at a conference table with the Assistant Director and four Sergeants from all the campuses in Chicago.  There was no particular organized way that the interview was conducted.  It was just these five people asking various questions about detainment procedures and my background.  Overall, it was an informal type of interview process which I was not use to.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself within the next 5 years?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Friendly, short and to the point. I enjoyed the interview process and getting to know the team. It was a casual but business professional. I got hired that day and the process was smooth and quick.
Interview Questions: Describe an experience where you were a leader

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Quick and mission based. I met with the associate directors, directors, and future colleagues. I had to do a presentation for my colleagues and answered personal questions for the ASsociate directors and deans
Interview Questions: What interested you in the positin

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: They called me in, asked me a few basic questions. And it was in one of the conference rooms. They wanted to know about me, my major, and my past experiences
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for this office?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at DePaul University
Interview Descriptions: Average, lasted less than hour, only interviewed with the direct supervisor. Standard questions regarding my back ground and experience. Heard within a week regarding the position. There was no negotiating salary.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: the interview lasts about 20 mins, there are two interviewer, and they will ask you several question. I did not remember the details of the process, you should do your self introduction first, since I apply for the STS, they asked me about my schedule, I think it is an important question since you may get work according to your schedule
Interview Questions: How do you think about STS

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Basic and easy interview questions, very easy to answer. interviewed with the department chair and the department assistant. Just prepare to answer what is on your resume and you will be fine.
Interview Questions: can you muti-task

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at DePaul University
Interview Descriptions: Did not have an interview for my program; instead I submitted my resume, a writing sample, my transcript, and a cover letter. Instead of an interview, offers to visit the program were extended at the same time an offer is extended
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: My interview consisted of a panel of three staff.  One of which was promoted, the other had accepted another position.   They each took turns asking questions about how I qualify for the job.  They asked me to describe a time in which I helped a difficult customer.  Since I was a student they asked if that would interfere with my shift.  They asked what were my hourly wage expectations.
Interview Questions: What is your strength and weaknesses?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very laid back. The questions were generally pretty easy. I would definitely come prepared with having at least researched the position and who's involved with the position.
Interview Questions: How do you feel you would fit into this position?

title: Telefund Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Starts with a phone interview, really simple process, asks to do a few different examples of what could happen while on the phone. Is willing to give you time to figure out an answer
Interview Questions: Gave an example of a refusal and asked what I'd do.

title: Student Stuff Exam Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very great manger and one of the current student stuff.  Very pleasant communication with more on behavior questions.  Face to face interview about 8 questions. Including your excel skill, office mail using experience. Something you would like to highlight on your resume.
Interview Questions: What's your strength and weaknesses.

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interviews with ~ 5 people each. They asked basic questions about previous experience and what ideas you had for the role. None of the questions were too surprising and it was all things I've heard before, but I would prepare nonetheless just so you aren't stumbling through any questions.
Interview Questions: How do you relate to the Vincentian Values of DePaul?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Round 1: essays, Round 2: group interview, Round 3: two person panel, 8 to 10 questions, intimate setting, very casual atmosphere. Cut made after each round. Professional dress recommended for Rounds 2 and 3
Interview Questions: How will you balance building community and rule enforcing?

title: Lab Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was a mess. I was contacted by a temporary recruiter by email, followed by a phone interview. The position was misrepresented, and I had no idea what the real title was called, because the recruiter said it was a tech position, but the website said coordinator. The phone interviewer was 10 minutes late, and admit-tingly told me they had accepted a personal call right before I was supposed to interview. (I should have resigned then). Next, was another phone interview, followed by an in-person with the person I would be working with.  This was the same person who set-up my in-person. I was expecting an email from them for directions on where to go/how to get there. I received no such email. Luckily, I managed to find the location, but only that. I called the number from my phone interview, only to find no answer. I wandered around for 10 minutes, and called again, with no answer. Luckily, I eventually found it, only to have found that my interviewer was late... So no email, no phone call, and could not call me telling me they would be late. Following this, we toured the facilities and talked a little bit about the program. There were a lot of "What if this happened..." questions. 

I was told there would be a follow-up the following Monday whether or not I got the position, but instead, the job was just reposted, with no word from the department.
Interview Questions: What would you do if someone wanted you to stop the simulation?

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: No interview,just contact the school adviser by email with the transcript, she will consider and contact  you by email.But first you have to know who is the adviser handling recruiting this grader job in you college
Interview Questions: N/A

title: DePaul Information Services Classroom Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process took around two weeks after the posting was closed from the school employment website. It was fairly easy and the most important thing was having a schedule that fits the employer needs. Any student is a candidate for this job regardless of major. The only major requirement is to have a basic knowledge of computers and audio and video equipment.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an emergency in case you were the only person working?

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University
Interview Descriptions: Information session preceding a group style interview, followed by a 3-4 week long decision process. The hiring process is crucial. Every aspect of the time you are in front of interviewers will be monitored. The information session has a duration of 30 minutes, and the interview lasts an hour. You will be interviewed by two former orientation leaders who now serve as the orientation coordinators.
Interview Questions: Given these two topics, off the top of your head create and tell a story for two minutes.

title: Admission Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I participated in a phone interview and then on-campus interview. For the on-campus interview, I met with a few different groups of people, including current counselors as well as directors. I also had to prepare a presentation to give in front of one of the groups, about 10 minutes in length.
Interview Questions: What about this job appeals to you?

title: TSC Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at DePaul University
Interview Descriptions: Submit résumé through online job board. Got an interview in a week or two with the manager of the position offered. Interview was a quick one on one regarding knowledge of customer service and computer troubleshooting.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you found yourself in a situation where you could not offer a realistic solution?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Great, quite laid back, short, met with one of the supervisors descriptive details of the department was provided. Overall, it was a nice experience. Was contacted few weeks later to be offered the job
Interview Questions: strengths and weaknesses, My interest in DePaul, My vision for DePaul

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Overall, I did not have the best experience. The interviewers seemed kind of in a hurry to get through my interview and were not at all familiar with my resume (one thought I had sales experience, but I don't). So the feeling of being rushed, along with the fact that the interviewers were unprepared really put me off.
Interview Questions: nothing really. easy typical answers.  nothing out of the blue

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was called in, interviewed, given a tour of the department, and that was it. Had to fill out some forms with the student employment office, which was a mess at the time and kept loosing my forms, but they got better as the years went on.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to use a copy machine?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was a three step process.  1. presentation on a topic of your choice 2.  interviewed by panel of  admission counselors 3.  interviewed by senior staff.  All of this occurred on the same day.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite part about being an alumna?

title: Marketing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview plus panel interview. In total both lasted about 2 hours. It was revealed to me that the hiring manager was resigning, which was misleading especially finding out in the last 20 minutes. It was nearly three weeks before I received word after not only a thank you email, follow up email, and voicemail. I had a feeling I didn't hit the right buttons but felt I waited way too long to be let down by someone in HR that I'd never met, only to hear the cliche "they've decided to go in a different direction". Newsflash--that is never a helpful response to job seekers. I will not be recommending DePaul to fellow job seekers due to my experience.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview with Director/Direct report - As opposed to a recruiter or HR personnel. 
In-person interview with your boss, their boss, and the team you'd be working with all in one day, but separate meetings. You really get to know the people.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Course Online Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty straight forward. First round was communicating via call. That lead to second on site interview. Third round was team interview, an interview with the currently working team. They will ask you few basic questions and your responses will be recorded for the final decision.
Interview Questions: Q: One word to best describe yourself

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at DePaul University
Interview Descriptions: Fill out application and submit resume. You do not find out whether or not you have the position until the end of July/ early August. You do not find out which professor you are working for until the beginning of September.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a graduate assistant?

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
6 hour interview process.

You will meet with all of the directors for different departments.  It is a very formal interview.

You will have a lunch provided on campus with an impromptu interview with your team.  Following that you meet with your immediate boss and are sent home.

It starts in the loop and ends in Lincoln Park.

They touch on all of your job duties, your dedication factor, and interest level.  Be enthusiastic and STRESS their MISSION!!! I cannot say that enough.  It is the main portion of DePaul and they need mission driven people.
Interview Questions: All of them are fairly equivalent.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DePaul University in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I sat down with the director of the department. She reviewed my CV, cover letter and references. I expected them to at least ask for a teaching demonstration but I think because I am an alumni they eliminated this step in the process.
Interview Questions: Where did you last teach etc.

title: Group Fitness Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at DePaul University
Interview Descriptions: easy if they are in need of more people
Interview Questions: what type of class do you want to teach?

title: ELearning Content Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at DePaul University
Interview Descriptions: Applied through DePaul's Job Website, got contacted a few days after for an interview. It was a panel interview with 3 different interviewers.
Interview Questions: It was mostly them telling about the job. They asked a little bit about my technical skills and how I used them in the past.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Fairly standard. Asked some behavioral questions and then standard interview questions as well. It was one day and I heard back in 2 days. The person who interviewed me was very nice and she was also really reasonable with scheduling.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to deal with a difficult situation and how did you handle it?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was asked how well of a leader I would be, what new creative ideas I could bring to the table as well as how long I would be at the office. It was a student position so most supervisors leave after they graduate.
Interview Questions: What kind of a leader would you be?

title: Helpdesk Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online on university's job portal website. First I was interviewed on phone and was informed to wait if I qualify for next round. After three day there I was invited for 1:1 interview with the immediate supervisor and got hired for position.
Interview Questions: Most of interview question were related to the work that I have done in past.

title: Data Entry Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Interview took a half hour. Heard from DePaul 3 days later. Interview questions were pretty basic ones.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: I flew out for a two day interview. On the first night, I had dinner with prospective colleagues. On the next day, I gave a presentation of my research and taught an undergraduate class. I also met with prospective colleagues one-on-one.
Interview Questions: What if black communities pushed for mandatory minimum sentencing?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at DePaul University
Interview Descriptions: Hiring is very slow at DePaul, like it is at most universities. I experienced a two month delay between my application and hearing back for the initial phone interview; by that time, I had nearly given up on the job. Most times, there is a 30 minute phone interview with the basic questions: Why would you like this job? What challenges have you faced and how did you overcome them? Next was a group interview with the entire department and the HR manager (3 people), plus a follow-up with the boss. It is important to stress DePaul's mission and values in any interview, because that is the driving factor behind all the work that is done here.
Interview Questions: How would you say you exemplify the mission of St. Vincent de Paul?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume online through DePaul's student employment service. The administrative assistant in the department called me over the phone and conducted a brief phone interview. They asked me to come in for an in-person interview a few days later. During the 1:1, I was asked basic questions about my experience, goals, and availability. I was offered the position the following week.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to work as a team.

title: Athletic Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resumeand cover letter and within a week I recieved a phone call asking for an in-person interview. I had the interview and within 7-10 I got another phone call telling me I got the job.

Nothing unexpected. Just basic behavioral questions.
What job did you like most and why

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at DePaul University in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: This was a phone interview. It lasted a total of 10 minutes and was comprised of very basic interview questions. Operated like a conversation and was very relaxed. Interviewer was interested in my technical skills and what sort of communication I had with students at my other position. Was offered the job two days later.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a time you used Excel in the workplace.

title: Data Verification Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I was called to the CNA building in downtown Chicago for the interview. I reached the location in time. The interviewer started out by explaining what the job was about. The position was newly created and he explained the reasons for its creation. 

After that he didn't ask any questions and we had 30 minute scheduled for this interview. I spent the time asking questions about the position, telling about myself, explaining how I'm the ideal candidate for the position. I was sent off 20 minutes later with a firm handshake and a promise of a call within 2 weeks. 

3 weeks later, with no call or correspondence from DePaul, I emailed the office manager and the interviewer but didn't get any reply. A couple of days later the office manager called to tell me the position was filled and wished me good luck for my future.
Interview Questions: No questions were asked as such.

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied through their online HR portal. I also contacted a friend who worked at DePaul and asked her to forward my resume. I received a call for a phone interview within 2 weeks of meeting with my friend. The phone interview as with HR and went very well. The questions seemed fairly standard, but the representative was both positive and encouraging. She was easy to engage with and seemed motivated to get to know me. 
I had an in person interview scheduled two weeks later. The in-person interview was done in a group with the others in the positive along with the manager. They were friendly and helpful throughout the process. I was told I would be contacted with 2-3 weeks about a decision. It took more like 5 weeks before I heard back. I was called in for a second interview where I gave a 30 minute presentation and had a meeting with the Dean. That was more awkward, but it still went well. I received an offer within a week of the presentation.
Interview Questions: What's your greatest weakness?

title: Immunizations Coordinator Interview

Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone interview followed by in-person panel interview with the manager and assistant director, and then a third interview with the assistant director and department director.  The questions were pretty standard, nothing really off guard was asked.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview

Most DePaul professors are easy-going though so if you're thinking about reaching out to them before you apply, do so, then maybe you can use them as a reference.
Interview Questions: What do you think makes you a great teacher?

title: IT Field Technician Interview

Interview Descriptions: There was a quick phone interview and an in-person one. I was interviewed by the two IT specialists of Lincoln Park campus. They let me know I got the job couple days later. Usually it takes long time for HR to post the job on their website, so it'd be better if you can have somebody working there recommend you to them.
Interview Questions: Experience in Help Desk, printer and Windows/Mac computer troubleshooting, how familiar with the university campus

title: Assistant Professor Interview

Interview Descriptions: Process was very quick. Several rounds but did not go bad at all. Very easy behavioral questions and were very socially focused. Test was very difficult. Understanding some of what was being asked was a little difficult. Started working a few years ago. Interview took a little longer than expected at their downtown location.

title: Technology Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions:
First I received a call from the hiring manager at the particular school or college to confirm my interest, then to notify me that HR would call schedule an interview with them.

HR called shortly thereafter to schedule an in-person interview with them. The HR interview included general questions about working at an academic institution, then general questions related to the position itself. The responses to those questions would be relayed to the hiring manager to determine if a second interview was warranted.

I then received a call from the hiring manager to schedule an in-person interview. A few days later, I had a friendly conversation with hiring manager to review my background; the job in greater detail; the school/college itself; and the selection committee which I was about to meet. The committee, comprised of faculty and staff, asked very specific questions related to the job, and I was also invited to ask questions of them. The total interview lasted about one-and-a-half hours.

I received a call about ten days later from the hiring manager informing me of their decision.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working at a university?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at DePaul University in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: It depends on the division, but it is often at least a half-day to a full-day interview. I personally think it's a bit lengthy for the work we do and can be a poor use of staff time and dollars. If you're interviewing, be prepared to meet with a lot of people and for an exhausting process.
Interview Questions: Always be prepared to talk about the mission of DePaul

title: Training and Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: I first has a phone interviewer with one of the staffing recruiters in early June.  By the end of June I had received a phone call back that I was one of the finalists.  I then had another phone interview with the recruiter and set up a time for an in person interview. The interview was about 1 hour long and included the whole team I would be working with including the person I would be replacing.  I then took a basic Microsoft Office test.  I later received an email stating that I was one of the finalists and they asked me to create a presentation on a set of data information that they had provided.
Interview Questions: What are you best at doing out of the ADDIE continuum?

title: Research Assistant Interview

There were also some team building and leadership questions because part of the job requires your to work with freshmen and other undergraduates.

title: Assistant Director Interview

In preparation, think about how your services affect students and what you would do to connect with students, how your team helps the university meet it's goals, etc. Friendly staff and interview process was professional and straightforward, albeit long.
Interview Questions: Tap into values, strategic thinking, how I'd solve problems.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview

The interviewer reviewed my resume asking fairly expected questions, and it was generally a very pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: All of the questions were intuitive.

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process goes as such. You have a group interview then a single interview if you make the group process. Here are some tips for the group interview

- Don't insult anyone
- Give people compliments
- Try to be a team player
- Let others take the lead
- Get others to give feedback

RA'ing is all about putting a fake face on to build community. So, just think off all the bad things people do in group situations and just don't do those things. I remember when I was a proctor of these interviews we hated individuals who just took charge the whole time. Leadership is good, not including others and shooting down other people's ideas isn't. Let others speak and include them and don't be obnoxious.

The single interview is quite easy:

- First and foremost know DePaul's mission statement and its values. 
- Read up on conflict managment. They will ask you questions about how you would solve a conflict just don't say anything stuipd such as "I would yell at the person". Talk about how you would look at both sides and stay calm during these kinds of situations. 
- They'll ask you how you would build community just have some ideas on how you would do that in a Residence Hall. Cookies for everyone, go out and see a show in Chicago you know things like that.

- One question that usually trumps people is "How you would helped underepresented minorities?" this could include the LGBTQ community, African Americans, Asians and such. Just a tip, if you are a underepresented minority yes talk about your own self however focus on other minorities. We always get the LGBTQ guy or girl who just talks about the LGBTQ community. Yes, we know you can be an advocate for them but how can you be an advocate for others? 

Answer: talk about how you'll get involved with on-campus stuff that already exists. 

Couple other tips:

Just think professional and practice. If you need someone to repeat the question again ask and don't be afraid to ask for clarification. If you don't know an answer or can't think of something on the spot just make up something that makes you look good.
Interview Questions: How would you be an advocate for underepresented minorities on campus?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview itself was fine. They are very focused on finding a match that goes beyond skills and aligns with the university's mission/vision. The worst part was not the interview itself, but DePaul's very slow HR process when it comes to hiring/on-boarding. Also there is no room for salary negotiation, at least not at mid-level for staff.
Interview Questions: What are your plans in the next 5 years, do you plan to use the tuition waiver?

title: Coordinator of Academic Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions:
I brushed up my resume and was anxiously searching for a new position (preferably external, but was willing to consider internal).  DePaul was external.  I found the opening through their career site, posted my resume, and filled out the online application.  I don't believe I had any connections at the university then.

I had been working in higher education administration at the time (mostly Registrar or academic records type experience) and felt that this would be a good move for me.  The position struck me as something of a glorified academic advisor with some additional operational responsibilities.  It was not advertised at the time that this position was for the School of Theatre.  My undergrad and "background" were in theatre, so this was more than a pleasant surprise.

Looking back at my records, I was contacted within a few days of my having posted the resume, and I was able to set up a phone interview with a member of the "search committee", who were conducting further review of at least a few other applicants.

I really enjoyed the phone interview.  My interviewer commended my accomplishments, noting that I had the "good scout" qualities that they would typically look for.  He told me that this committee had reviewed the resumes submitted, whittled down applicants, and that I had made it to the "semi-final" round.

We had a great conversation.  His experience with the school and university were quite extensive, and this being a passion of mine, I was not at a loss for informational questions to ask.

A little over a month went by, and I was not contacted for the position.  I decided to contact my interviewer to thank him once more and to wish them the best.  I was then and am now still thinking heavily on what academic or professional direction I should try to take next, so I asked whether I might keep him as a contact.  I heard back within hours, and he graciously agreed to help out however he might be able.

As a side note, I recently contacted this individual once more, and he actually remembered who I was.  He definitely left me with a great feeling about DePaul and gave me some really good background information about DePaul's Vincentian roots.  It sounds like a great place to work.
Interview Questions: Artists can be very sensitive people.  How would you address an emotional/hysterical student?

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Talked to the business coordinator, and she hired me.
Interview Questions: When can you start?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2010

Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: I only interviewed with the two people I would be reporting to.  The process was simple.  Each department here has a different way of interviewing, so it's difficult to give any advice here.  Just make sure you have researched the company and the department that you are interviewing with.  DePaul is big on giving and volunteering, so having that on your resume is a plus.
Interview Questions: How do you handle confidential situations.

title: Assistant Director, International Programs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: The Director of the International Programs Office made an initial call to me from home at dinnertime with her young child in the background and talked with me for 45 minutes.  She set up an official phone interview with her for the next day.  The day after that I had another phone interview with the person who left the position the year before and who now lives in Canada.  I also had to write 2 essays and then I had an in-person interview with the Director and two staff members. Before the interview began I had to do a crazy timed test that checked my accuracy skills.  I had to ask to have a tour of the office and when she gave me the tour, she ran around pointing at doors and couldn't seem to get rid of me fast enough.  This position has been open for two years and I know many colleagues who are well- qualified and have interviewed for the position but no one has been given an offer.  The Director told me that she and the previous employee were like sisters and she seemed to place a lot of weight on the "right personality fit."  I think she's looking for another sister.
Interview Questions: Where do you get your news?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: HR does a brief phone interview and then the actual department does the interviewing so it was with the immediate supervisor. Easy interview - more conversational. Seemed like if you make a personal connection, you do well. Of course, I had the experience they were asking for. I think it was clear that we got along well and therefore, I was more at ease and it was a good fit for everyone.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had a conflict with a co-worker - how did you handle that?

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at DePaul University (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Questions about previous work experience. Asked for examples of positive and negative experiences in the work place. No trick questions.
Interview Questions: Give us one example of a negative experience you have had in the work place.

title: Desk Receptionist Interview
